intro: Picramnia antidesma subsp. antidesma, commonly known as the African velvet tree, is a member of the Rhamnaceae family. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree, typically reaching heights of up to 10 meters. The plant is characterized by its smooth, dark green leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, fleshy berries that are edible for some bird species. It is native to various regions in Africa and is often found in moist, shaded habitats.
